text: 2010 is gone. A hard but fertile year, which put us to the test and allowed us to get the best out of ourselves. Up the hearts
I wish you all a very happy New Year, I am looking forward to continuing to work with you all for the prosperity of Rwanda- pKagame
With this New Year I intend to personally interact with you more via Twitter.

U kno this world has many divides which pple use difrntly! Countries,tribes n races,religions,cultures,poor n rich,technological etc etc!!
Whichever side of the divide one stands..No one has monopoly of the Truth,no one side or individual has exclusive claim to be right ...!
N others wrong! Hence the golden value of listening,humility n dialogue. Of justice,honesty n fairness and deeds that have that as a basis!
The poor/rich and technological divides seem to be really the critical ones-!!!
They tend to make some on the better side falsely think they have a right over others...!
Yet it s also true,that there is no such permanent state of being poor,lacking in technology etc! And there shd not be...!
Rwanda and Africa have learned more than enough lessons not to make same mistakes over n over!!! It s within our reach to bring CHANGE..!
@jess I am not very sure what we can do exactly that wud bring ol HOS to tweet but we can try n keep inviting them to!!

We had 117 schools converted into shelters. Today, 108 of them started classes. That is, 92.4%. Congratulations to all my team! To classes!
Queenslanders are coping with tragedy today and a growing flood crisis.  Our thoughts and sympathies are with them. JG
@KokodaKelly The people who deserve our praise are the amazing Aussies engaged in search & rescue, fighting the floods & relief work. JG
@ShaunGarrity Queenslanders will need our support for a long time. We will all be there for them as they face these sad & trying times. JG
Many questions came to @MinPres. Thanks for that! Thursday MP answers a few questions in a video. #questionMP
After yesterday's visit to Yemen we completed yesterday, Mehmet Niyazi's "Yemen Ah Yemen" sad story told in the book http://twitpic.com/3paohx
and I understand the feeling better today.
One of the most impressive aspects of my visit to Yemen is the careful preservation of the traces of Turkish existence http://twitpic.com/3paoze
was to see.
While many of our historical works were destroyed and the bricks were destroyed and destroyed, I was careful about the care they showed against the Turkish artifacts of the Yemeni people.
